title: Advanzia AutoLend
subtitle: AI-Driven Dynamic Credit Limit Optimization
problem: Traditional credit limit adjustments rely on static rules that fail to adapt to real-time risk signals, leaving portfolio profit on the table while exposing lenders to uncontrolled default rates.
approach: Implemented an offline Double DQN policy with Dueling Architecture in PyTorch to dynamically adjust credit limits. Integrated a Cox Proportional Hazard Model for default probability estimation and built a FastAPI decision gateway for real-time inference.
outcomes: 5000+ real-time evaluations/min with sub-second latency
Portfolio risk maintained below 7%
8% increase in spending efficiency via n8n workflow automation
Auditable inference logs for regulatory compliance

title: CampusIntel Phase 2
subtitle: Unified Campus Intelligence System
problem: Educational institutions lack unified platforms that combine campus automation, AI-powered student assistance, and document processing into a single, accessible system.
approach: Built a comprehensive multi-service platform with AI chat powered by FAISS-based RAG, smart library management, automated OCR-based document processing, and a real-time communication layer — all deployed as containerized microservices.
outcomes: Live production deployment on Render
Multi-service architecture (4 backend services)
AI-powered campus assistant with RAG retrieval
Top 3 in HackTheWinter offline final round

title: DOC-OC
subtitle: Automated Marksheet Extraction System
problem: Manual transcription of academic marksheets across different education boards is slow, error-prone, and doesn't scale — taking ~10 minutes per document.
approach: Engineered a multi-board extraction pipeline using YOLO for document region detection and Table Transformers (HuggingFace) for structured data parsing. Built scalable REST APIs with FastAPI and a React frontend for the processing workflow.
outcomes: 99.98% extraction accuracy across multiple boards
30x processing speedup (10 min → ~30s per marksheet)
Developed under guidance of Dr. Prof. Ashish Garg
Production-ready pipeline with CLI and web interface

title: Cargo Laytime
subtitle: SOF Document Processing & Laytime Calculator
problem: Maritime professionals manually parse Statement of Facts (SOF) documents for vessel/voyage data and laytime calculations — a tedious, error-prone process critical to shipping logistics.
approach: Built a web application combining Google Document AI for OCR, Generative AI for intelligent text extraction, and maritime-specific calculation logic. FastAPI backend with a responsive HTML/CSS/JS frontend.
outcomes: Winner — MariTHON National Hackathon
Commercially deployed by Integrated Maritime Exchange
100% accuracy on production SOF documents
Full OCR → structured data → laytime calculation pipeline

title: Pustak Tracker
subtitle: Library Management System
problem: Small and institutional libraries need affordable, mobile-friendly management systems that don't require expensive barcode hardware.
approach: Architected a full-stack library solution using Flutter for mobile and Flask for backend. Integrated mobile-vision barcode scanning to replace hardware scanners, with secure JWT authentication and automated fine calculation.
outcomes: Replaced hardware barcode scanners, saving ₹4,000 in infrastructure
Secure JWT-based authentication
Real-time book tracking and automated fine calculation
Mobile-first design with Flutter

title: LivAna 3.0
subtitle: Health & Lifestyle Companion App
problem: People struggle to maintain consistent health habits without a unified platform that tracks, motivates, and adapts to their lifestyle patterns.
approach: Developed across three iterations (LivAna → 2.0 → 3.0), progressively improving the architecture and feature set. Built with Flutter for cross-platform mobile support, focusing on clean UI and reliable data persistence.
outcomes: 3 major iterations demonstrating iterative engineering
Cross-platform mobile app (iOS + Android)
Clean Flutter architecture with state management
Focus on user engagement and habit formation
